entry.title: Move Zeroes
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Move Zeroes.

Description

Given an array nums, write a function to move all 0’s to the end of it while maintaining the relative order of the non-zero elements.

For example, given nums = [0, 1, 0, 3, 12], after calling your function, nums should be [1, 3, 12, 0, 0].

Note:
You must do this in-place without making a copy of the array.
Minimize the total number of operations.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

Maintain two pointers, one points to 0, one interate the whole array to find non zero digit to swap.

Solution2

  1. Iterate the array, find the location of first 0, maintain its index and assign the next non-zero digit to their original location one by one.
  2. assign 0 to the remaining locations.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode - Move Zeroes

entry.title: Day20 iOS Design Pattern
entry.content:
本篇是关于iOS Design Pattern的介绍和用途.

攻略模板

  • 总结归纳各种Design Pattern特性
  • 总结Design Pattern用法和常见情景

学习后总结

Prototype Pattern

用clone的方式来创建重复对象，避免一直创建对象所带来的资源耗损。并且能够简化复杂对象的创建过程。
Prototype pattern refers to creating duplicate object while keeping performance in mind. This type of design pattern comes under creational pattern as this pattern provides one of the best ways to create an object.

例如发送广告信息给500万用户，如果一条一条发的话可能需要好几天时间，相当于获取一个个创建的model object中信息并输出。如果创建多线程同时发送，并且避免创建500W个object带来的资源耗损，可以使用一个通用的object，然后每次copy得到新的实例而不是使用构造函数得到新实例，再修改里面一部分variable并且不会影响原Object来实现。

这就要求： 首先Object class 继承 Cloneable接口.

注意： 这里的clone只能是shallow copy, 所以只能拷贝primitive type的值和对象、数组的reference，我们需要对 对象、数组进行deep copy.

使用的时候则可以只创建一个新的object，之后不断clone来创建新的object.

缺点：

  1. 在实现clone时可能需要实现复杂的代码，多重嵌套引用的deep copy很麻烦；
  2. 每一个类都需要配置clone方法，当对已有类进行改造是，需要修改源代码，违背“开闭原则”.
entry.summary:
本篇是关于iOS Design Pattern的介绍和用途.

攻略模板

  • 总结归纳各种Design Patte

entry.title: Product of Array Except Self
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Product of Array Except Self.

Description

Given an array of n integers where n > 1, nums, return an array output such that output[i] is equal to the product of all the elements of nums except nums[i].

Solve it without division and in O(n).

For example, given [1,2,3,4], return [24,12,8,6].

Follow up:
Could you solve it with constant space complexity? (Note: The output array does not count as extra space for the purpose of space complexity analysis.)

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

Let’s take an example:

Given array[1, 2, 3, 4, 5], regarding the third number 3, the product of array except 3 is 1 2 and right is 4 5. The product is left * right.

So time complexity is O(n+n), the extra space is O(1).

Solution2

Similar with Solution1, instead of variable temp, we use result[0] to store right product.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode

entry.title: Odd Even Linked List
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Odd Even Linked List.

You should try to do it in place. The program should run in O(1) space complexity and O(nodes) time complexity.

Example:

Note:
The relative order inside both the even and odd groups should remain as it was in the input.
The first node is considered odd, the second node even and so on …

Solution

Analysis

Solution

  1. connect odd and even node respectively
  2. And then connect the last odd with the first even node.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode - Odd Ev

entry.title: Sum of Two Integers
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Sum of Two Integers.

Description

Calculate the sum of two integers a and b, but you are not allowed to use the operator + and -.

Example:
Given a = 1 and b = 2, return 3.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. First recall addition in primary school. e.g. 26 + 147 = 173. You start by 6 + 7 = 13, so you put the 3 in the sum, and carry the one, and so forth…
  1. First find the carry: int carry = (a & b)
  2. Then store the first digit position, and store it in a = (a ^ b)
  3. Shift the carry to the next digit position: carry << 1
  4. The while loop continues as long as there are carries that has bot been included in the sum.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode - Sum of

entry.title: Unique Paths II
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Unique Paths II.

Description

Follow up for “Unique Paths”:

Now consider if some obstacles are added to the grids. How many unique paths would there be?

An obstacle and empty space is marked as 1 and 0 respectively in the grid.

For example,
There is one obstacle in the middle of a 3x3 grid as illustrated below.

The total number of unique paths is 2.

Note: m and n will be at most 100.

Solution

Analysis For DP

  • State: f[i][j] represents the number of unique paths from start to coordinate(x,y)
  • Function: f[i][j] = if(obstacleGrid[i][j] == 0) f[i-1][j] + f[i][j-1] (思考：怎样到达(i,j)这一步，到达这一步之前我们有多少选择)
  • Initialize: if(obstacleGrid[i][j] == 0) f[i][0] = 1; f[0][j] = 1
  • Answer: f[m-1][n-1]
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode - Unique Path

entry.title: Factorial Trailing Zeroes
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-First Bad Version.

Description

Given an integer n, return the number of trailing zeroes in n!.

Note: Your solution should be in logarithmic time complexity.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. n! = 2 3 4 5 … (5 2) … (5^2 1) … (5^2 * 2) …
  2. Each time, we divide n by 5 and collect its quotient
  3. Time complexity is lg5N.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode-First Bad V

entry.title: Decode Ways
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Decode Ways.

Description

A message containing letters from A-Z is being encoded to numbers using the following mapping:

Given an encoded message containing digits, determine the total number of ways to decode it.

For example,
Given encoded message “12”, it could be decoded as “AB” (1 2) or “L” (12).

The number of ways decoding “12” is 2.

Solution

Analysis For DP

  • State: f[i] represents the number of ways to decode it.
  • Function: f[i] = f[i] + if(前一位数字>0) f[i-1] + if(10 <= 前两位数字 <= 26) f[i-2]
  • Initialize: f[0] = 1 , f[1] = if(前一位数字 == 0) 0 ， else 1.
  • Answer: f[s.length()]
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode - Decode Ways

Solution

Analysis

Solution

  1. Maintain Maximum product and Minimum product , each time get their value
  2. compare maximum one with result to store the maximum result until now.

entry.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock with Cooldown
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock with Cooldown.

Description

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i.

Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete as many transactions as you like (ie, buy one and sell one share of the stock multiple times) with the following restrictions:

You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (ie, you must sell the stock before you buy again).
After you sell your stock, you cannot buy stock on next day. (ie, cooldown 1 day)

Example:

Solution

Analysis

Solution:DP

  • The natural states for this problem is the 3 possible transactions: buy,sell,rest. For each of them we make an array, buy[n],sell[n] and rest[n]. And it means before day i the maxProfit for any sequence end with buy or sell or rest.
  • Function:

Notice:

the fact that buy[i] <= rest[i] , so rest[i] = Max(rest[i-1], sell[i-1]).

the fact that rest[i] <= sell[i] , so rest[i] = sell[i-1].

  • So we have 2 functions instead of 3:
  • Since states of day i relies on i-1 and i-2, we can reduce the O(n) space to O(1).
entry.summary: This is the solution about

entry.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV.

Description

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i.

Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete at most k transactions.

Note:
You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (ie, you must sell the stock before you buy again).

Solution

Analysis

Solution:DP

  • State: profit[i][j] represents the maximum profit until i-th price and j transactions.
  • Function: profit[i][j] = MAX(profit[i-1][j], prices[i]-prices[i’]+profit[i’][j-1]) (i’ is in 0 - i range)
  • Initialize: profit[i][0] = 0, profit[0][j] = 0.
  • Answer: profit[prices.length-1][k]

tmpMax = Math.max(tmpMax, profit[i-1][j-1] - prices[i]) means the maximum profit of just doing at most j-1 transactions, using at most first i-1 prices, and buying the stock at prices[i].
entry.summary: This is the solution about Lee

entry.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III.

Description

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i.

Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete at most two transactions.

Note:
You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (ie, you must sell the stock before you buy again).

Solution

Analysis

Solution

  1. firstBuy: means we have to borrow money from others, we need borrow as less as possible to get the maximum profit. But the value is negative(-price), so we should pick max one.
  2. firstSell: after buy stock, we need sell stock in a higher price. So profit = price - |firstBuy| = price + firstBuy.
  3. secondBuy: after first transaction, we get the profit 即 firstSell, then similar with firstBuy, we get firstSell-price.
  4. secondSell: similar with firstSell, we get the profit is price + secondBuy.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Le

entry.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II.

Description

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i.

Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete as many transactions as you like (ie, buy one and sell one share of the stock multiple times). However, you may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (ie, you must sell the stock before you buy again).

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  • State: f[i] represents the maximum profit.
  • Function: f[i] = f[i-1] + (if(prices[i]>prices[i-1])prices[i] - prices[i-1]), update stock to the current one.
  • Initialize: f[0] = 0, stock = prices[0]
  • Answer: f[nums.length-1]

Solution2

Just add all positive difference between two adjacent elements.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Lee

entry.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock.

Description

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i.

If you were only permitted to complete at most one transaction (ie, buy one and sell one share of the stock), design an algorithm to find the maximum profit.

Example 1:

Example 2:

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. For each element, compare with other elements and find out the maximum one.
  2. Time complexity is O(n^2)

Solution2

  1. Record a minimum price and calculate its difference if the current is greater than min Price.
  2. Time complexity is O(n)
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetco

entry.title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Search in Rotated Sorted Array.

Description

Suppose a sorted array is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.

(i.e., 0 1 2 4 5 6 7 might become 4 5 6 7 0 1 2).

You are given a target value to search. If found in the array return its index, otherwise return -1.

You may assume no duplicate exists in the array.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

Iterate through the array to find the target.

Solution2

  1. Find Min index
  2. compare target with the last element to ensure left and right index.
  3. Use Binary Search to find the target.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcod

entry.title: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-First Bad Version.

Description

Suppose a sorted array is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.

(i.e., 0 1 2 4 5 6 7 might become 4 5 6 7 0 1 2).

Find the minimum element.

You may assume no duplicate exists in the array.

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. Iterate through the array to find out the element which is greater than the next one.
  2. Time complexity is O(n)

Solution2

  1. Binary search to find out this element
  2. If the middle one is less than right one, assign mid to right index.
  3. If the middle one is greater than right one, assign mid+1 to left index.
  4. Time complexity is O(lgn)
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode-First Bad V

entry.title: Rotate Array
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode-Rotate Array.

Description

Rotate an array of n elements to the right by k steps.

For example, with n = 7 and k = 3, the array [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] is rotated to [5,6,7,1,2,3,4].

Solution

Analysis

Solution1

  1. rotete one by one.
  2. Time complexity is O(k*n), Space complexity is O(1)
  3. TIme Limit Exceeded

Solution2

  1. Use an array to store the last k elements first
  2. shift all remaining elements to the right
  3. put k elements to the left.
  4. Time complexity is O(n), Space complexity is O(k)

Solution3

  1. Reverse first size - k elements
  2. Reverse last k elements
  3. Reverse all elements
  4. Time complexity is O(n), Space complexity is O(1)

Solution4

  1. create a new array to store all elements
  2. reasign the value into the original array
  3. Time complexity is O(n), Space complexity is O(n)
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode-Rotate Array

entry.title: Remove Element
entry.content:
This is the solution about Leetcode - Remove Element.

Description

Given an array and a value, remove all instances of that value in place and return the new length.

Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this in place with constant memory.

The order of elements can be changed. It doesn’t matter what you leave beyond the new length.

Example:
Given input array nums = [3,2,2,3], val = 3

Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 2.

Solution

Analysis

Solution

  1. Maintain one pointer, point to the first location
  2. Iterate each element, if the element is the same with target, do nothing
  3. If not, replace the value which the pointer points using this element.
entry.summary: This is the solution about Leetcode - Remove Eleme
